articles.description: New Delhi: A few days after the Centre announced scaling up inoculation against the Covid-19 infection by allowing all above 18 years of age to take their vaccines from May 1, concerns over taking Covid-19 jabs during periods [menstruation] surfaced.

articles.author: Bhavyata Kagrana
articles.title: Is COVID vaccine unsafe during menstruation? All you need to know - Republic TV
articles.description: Everyone above the age of 18 should get vaccinated from May 1 says government as fake claims of vaccine unsafe during menstruation takes round on social media.
articles.content:
Claim: Women should not take the vaccine five days before and after the menstrual cycle.
Claimed by: Social media
Rating: False
As fake posts on vaccine unsafe during menstruation started spreadin… [+2481 chars]

articles.title: Covishield offers protection from 'double mutant', says CCMB - Daily Pioneer
articles.description:
nCovishield vaccine offers protection from double mutant variant of novel coronavirus, shows a study by the Centre for Cellular and Molecular Biology (CCMB).

The CCMB Director Rakesh K. Mishra termed this as a very preliminary but encouraging result.
